modelname.doc: Type of the model: (1) LES (Large Eddy Simulation): full 3D incompressible Navier-Stokes equations (2) linear: 3D incompressible Navier-Stokes equations linearized around a stationary mean state, i.e., without the vortex-force and kinetic-energy terms, which are quadratic in velocity (3) advection: 3D advection equations applied on a passive tracer in a steady flow

Lx.doc: Length of the domain along x (x-axis goes from 0 to Lx)

Ly.doc: Length of the domain along y (y-axis goes from 0 to Ly)

Lz.doc: Length of the domain along z (z-axis goes from 0 to Lz)

n_tracers.doc: Number of passive tracers to be advected with the flow; tracers are automatically added to the history file

unit_length.doc: Physical unit for lengths (extents in space) used in the model

unit_duration.doc: Physical unit for durations (amounts of time) used in the model

rotating.doc: Whether Coriolis force is present or not

coriolis.doc: Coriolis parameter in the vertical direction (in s^-1)

datadir.avail: any valid path (existent or not) with write access
datadir.doc: Folder in which the output files of the simulation are stored

expname.doc: Name of the experiment; used in the name of the output directory and output files

mode.doc: Handling of existing output files with the same name

variables_in_history.avail: a list of model variables or one of the strings "all", "prognostic", or "p+p"
variables_in_history.doc: Model variables to save in the history file can be: (1) a list of nicknames (2) the string "all" to select all model variables (3) the string "prognostic" to select all prognostic model variables (4) the string "p+p" to select all prognostic model variables and pressure; note that tracers are automatically saved in the history file

timestep_history.doc: Desired timestep for saving the model state in the history file; use 0.0 to save every iteration step of the model

simplified_grid.doc: Whether to save in the history file every variable at its actual coordinates of the staggered grid (physically and numerically correct) or to simplify and to save all variables at cell centers (slightly incorrect but sometimes more convenient); this does not influence the calcuations or the numerics, it only affects the history file

disk_space_warning.doc: Minimal amount of free disk space in GB; if the available space in the output directory (datadir) drops below this value, the simulation is paused and the user is asked whether they want to continue or stop the experiment; if the user clears disk space before resuming the program, the checks stay on, otherwise they are turned off; set this parameter to zero to disable checks

show.doc: Whether to display an animated 3D figure of the simulation or not (faster)

iterations_per_frame.doc: Number of calculation steps (n) until the animation updates; set to 1 to show the state after every iteration step (slow); note that this parameter ensures that about equal *calculation time* has passed between two updates, but not that equal *model time* has passed; use fix timesteps to ensure both

style.doc: Type of the animation: (1) b-interface: plot the interface of the central value of initial buoyancy (2) tracer: plot the position of all tracers in a scatter plot; tracers should be initialized with 1; the scatter plot shows where the value is bigger than 0.5

stable_stratification.doc: When the animation style is b-interface, it is necessary to say if the initial stratification is stable or unstable

rotation_speed.doc: Speed of the camera to rotate around the 3D scene in degrees per redraw

timestepping.doc: Time scheme used to integrate the model in time; EF: Euler forward; LFAM3: a predictor-corrector method

auto_dt.doc: Choice between automatic (True) or fixed (False) timestep dt

dt.doc: In the case of a fixed timestep, this is the timestep

cfl.doc: In the case of an automatic timestep, this is the coefficient that sets the timestep; it is usually on the order of 1.0; reduce it to have a more stable integration in time, increase it to have a faster but coarser integration in time

dt_max.doc: In the case of an automatic timestep, this is the maximal timestep (and the inital timestep if the initial velocity is zero); this parameter is important in situations where the dominant velocity is not the local velocity of the fluid parcels, e.g., in experiments with waves

global_nx.doc: Number of gridpoints for the full domain in x-direction; must be a power of 2

global_ny.doc: Number of gridpoints for the full domain in y-direction; must be a power of 2

global_nz.doc: Number of gridpoints for the full domain in z-direction; must be a power of 2

orderVF.doc: Order of the upwind scheme used for the computation of the vortex-force term

orderA.doc: Order of the upwind scheme used for the computation of the advection term

npx.doc: Number of subdomains (cores) in x; must be a power of 2 and cannot be larger than global_nx

npy.doc: Number of subdomains (cores) in y; must be a power of 2 and cannot be larger than global_ny

npz.doc: Number of subdomains (cores) in z; must be a power of 2 and cannot be larger than global_nz

nh.doc: Number of ghost points in the halo

npre.doc: Number of smoother iterations before coarsening

npost.doc: Number of smoother iterations after interpolation

ndeepest.doc: Number of smoother iterations at the coarsest level

omega.doc: Relaxation coefficient in the Jacobi smoother

tol.doc: Accuracy of the solution, such that ||r||/||b|| <= tol, r is the residual and b the rhs

maxite.doc: Maximum number of iterations per multigrid solve

nglue.doc: Subdomain width (in any direction) below which subdomains are glued together

ncellscoarsest.doc: Minimal size of a subdomain (in terms of nx*ny*nz). This defines the coarsest level.
